columns.text: In this problem, we will solve for the percentage of salary that is needed to be saved in order to achieve $\$4,000,000$ at retirement.

Substituting the values, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Present value}&=\dfrac{\$4,000,000}{(1+0.09)^{45}}\\[15 pt]
&=\$82,768.98
\end{aligned}$$

The present value of this is $\$82,768.98$

Substituting the values, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\$82,768.98&=\text{Cashflow} \times \dfrac{1-\left(\frac{1+0.03}{1+0.09}\right)^{45}}{0.09-0.03}\\[15 pt]
\$82,768.98&=\text{Cashflow}\times 15.3625
\end{aligned}$$

Divide both sides by $15.3625$ to get the cashflow value:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Cashflow}&=\dfrac{\$82,768.98}{15.3625}\\[15 pt]
&=\$5,387.73
\end{aligned}$$

The cashflow that we need to achieve the given target is $\$5,387.73$

Now to get the percentage, we can simply take the value in Step 6 then divide it by the annual salary.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Salary percentage}&=\dfrac{\$5,387.73}{\$50,000}\\[15 pt]
&=0.1078
\end{aligned}$$

The percentage that should be deposited is $0.1078$ or $10.78\%$
